text: it's basically the worst possible design you can have, your internal / programmable API has issues with it that are there to aid how the thing is displayed on the website

elements.text: it's basically the worst possible design you can have, your internal / programmable API has issues with it that are there to aid how the thing is displayed on the website

text: Pinnacle has a *phenomenal* thing about that - <https://pinnacleapi.github.io/linesapi#operation/Odds_Straight_V1_Get>

elements.text: they give you markets kinda like:

text: who's "home" and who's "away", you ask
they give you that info in <https://pinnacleapi.github.io/linesapi#operation/Fixtures_V1_Get>

elements.text: they give you that info in

text:
```{
"sportId": 0,
"last": 0,
"league": [
{
"id": 0,
"name": "string",
"events": [
{
"id": 0,
"parentId": 0,
"starts": "2018-08-24T11:45:52Z",
"home": "string",
"away": "string",
...```
*BUT* to bet, you *do not* use "home", nor "away" to place a moneyline, or handicap bet

elements.text: use "home", nor "away" to place a moneyline, or handicap bet

text: you use one of "TEAM1", "TEAM2", or "DRAW"
<https://github.com/pinnacleapi/pinnacleapi-documentation/blob/master/GettingStarted.md>

```check the value in the corresponding Get Leagues Response -> League Type -> homeTeamType and set the appropriate value.

Example 1:

Given:
    homeTeamType="Team1"
When:
    Selected odds is Spread Type -> away
Then:
    team=Team2
```

elements.text:
check the value in the corresponding Get Leagues Response -> League Type -> homeTeamType and set the appropriate value.

Example 1:

Given:
    homeTeamType="Team1"
When:
    Selected odds is Spread Type -> away
Then:
    team=Team2

text: you gots to get the league info, and store what "teamType" the home team is

elements.text: you gots to get the league info, and store what "teamType" the home team is

text: it is one of "TEAM1", or "TEAM2"
then, when you're betting, if you want to bet on the "home" team, if the league's "homeTeamType" is "TEAM1", you place your bet on "TEAM1", if the homeTeamType is "TEAM2", you bet on "TEAM2"

elements.text: then, when you're betting, if you want to bet on the "home" team, if the league's "homeTeamType" is "TEAM1", you place your bet on "TEAM1", if the homeTeamType is "TEAM2", you bet on "TEAM2"

text: if you want to bet on the "away" team, it's the opposite.  "TEAM2" if homeTeamType is "TEAM1", otherwise "TEAM1"

elements.text: if you want to bet on the "away" team, it's the opposite.  "TEAM2" if homeTeamType is "TEAM1", otherwise "TEAM1"

text: it's is an absolute mindmelt

and I *guarantee* the only reason it's designed like that is so they can use that API directly for the site, to display games correctly, i.e. which team should be displayed "On the left"/first, which is different for NFL to NCAAF, to MLB to EPL
